description._content: Les Amours de la pieuvre "Draped in her skin of changing colors, the amorous lady has closed her eyes...She has the heavy lids of a seductress, but the gaze within is always alert. Because this common mollusk has eyelids, she can vary her expression, unlike fish with the permanent surprise of their always-round eyes."- Bellows, Andy M., Marina McDougall, and Brigitte Berg, eds. Science is Fiction: the films of Jean Painlevé. San Francisco: Brico Press, 2000. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
